review: First, it's nowhere near as plug and play as the Roku and nowhere as feature rich. If you do not have wireless on your PC (I used a cable connect), you need to buy at least a wireless dongle (dongle to dongle, yeah, baby). However, I read an article recently (might have been on CNet) which said that down the line, it might get much better. I bought it just to have a back-up to Roku or if I positively had to show something on YouTube on my TV set (Roku won't let you do that).
author: Angel Jimenez "Crashophobic"

review: I LOVE my Chromecast. We have two in my house. It's so easy to set up and so easy to use. LOVE LOVE LOVE.
